title: Outbreak of severe gastroenteritis with multiple aetiologies caused by contaminated drinking water in Denmark, January 2007
cause: combination of a technical and a human error at a local sewage treatment facility
detection: drinking water in many houses was reported to be discoloured and of unusual smell and taste
mitigation: prohibited any use of the water - except for toilet flushing -
The citizens in the area were warned by the police and through radio broadcasts.
Geographical information systems were used to define the contaminated area

the distribution system was subsequently disinfected by chlorination
investigation: water samples for microbiological and chemical analyses were systematically collected from the water distribution system
